method.name: pppox_config
method.description: This procedure configures PPPoA, PPPoEoA, PPPoE sessions for the specified test port. This command allows the user to configure a specified number of PPPoX sessions on the test port. Each port can have upto 32000 sessions.

description.text: The role of the port in the test: access or network.

choice.choiceText: is PPPoX client
is PPPoX server

description.text: PPPoX handle of a configuration to be modified or removed. Dependencies: only available when IxNetwork is used for the PPPoX configuration. When -handle is provided with the /globals value the arguments that configure global protocol setting accept both multivalue handles and simple values. When -handle is provided with a a protocol stack handle or a protocol session handle, the arguments that configure global settings will only accept simple values. In this situation, these arguments will configure only the settings of the parent device group or the ports associated with the parent topology.
If checked, PPPoE unlimited redial attempts is enabled
Enable MRU Negotiation
Max Transmit Unit for PPP
Max Payload. Valid only when enable_max_payload is enabled.
Enables PPP Max Payload tag
Valid only when ip_cp is ipv6_cp or dual_stack
Valid only when ip_cp is ipv4_cp or dual_stack
Valid only when ip_cp is ipv6_cp or dual_stack
Valid only when ip_cp is ipv4_cp or dual_stack
Enable Async-Control-Character-Map
Async-Control-Character-Map. Valid only when lcp_enable_accm is enabled.

The number of PPP sessions to configure. For PPP servers this will configure the number of sessions supprted by each server. For PPP clients this will configure the number of client sessions that are available.
There are various ways AC can be selected based on the PADO received from AC.

choice.choiceText: (DEFAULT)
Specify the AC MAC Address and percentage pair using -ac_select_list.
Specify the AC Name and percentage pair using -ac_select_list option.

description.text: Specifies the timeout value in seconds for acknowledgement of an authentication Request.
Specifies the timeout value in seconds for acknowledgement of a Configure Request or Terminate Request.
When set to 1, enables Echo Requests, when set to 0, disables Echo Requests.

This can be used to do negative testing. Dependencies: -mode add (when IxNetwork is used for the PPPoX configuration). Valid choices are: 0 - Disable sending of the echo Responses. 1 - (DEFAULT) Enable Echo Replies.

choice.choiceText: IPv4 Control Protocol. When dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1 a PPPoX IPv4 range will be created that can coexist with other ranges from the same port created with dhcpv6_hosts_enable 1. An error will be issued if dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 0 and other ranges created with dhcpv6_hosts_enable 1 exist on the same port.

IPv6 Control Protocol. When dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1 a DHCPv6 behind PPP CPE range will be created. An error will be issued if dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 0 and other ranges created with dhcpv6_hosts_enable 1 exist on the same port.
Valid only when dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1. A dual stack DHCPv6 behind PPP CPE range will be created. An error will be issued if other ranges created with dhcpv6_hosts_enable 0 exist on the same port.

description.text: Specifies the timeout value in seconds for acknowledgement of an IPCP configure request.
Specifies the maximum number of Authentication Requests that can be sent without getting an authentication response from the DUT.
Specifies the maximum number of PADI Requests that can be sent without getting a PADO from the DUT.
Specifies the maximum number of PADR Requests that can be sent without getting a PADS from the DUT.
Specifies the maximum number of Terminate Requests that can be sent without acknowledgement.
Specifies the timeout value in seconds for acknowledgement of a PADI Request.
Specifies the timeout value in seconds for acknowledgement of a PADR Request.
Password, PAP and CHAP only.
Secret when CHAP Authentication is being used
Username, PAP and CHAP only.
User name when CHAP Authentication is being used
Starting VLAN ID, applies to PPPoE w/VLAN only.
Number of VLAN IDs, applies to PPPoE w/VLAN only.
Step value applied to VLAN ID, PPPoEoE w/VLAN only.
VLAN user priority, PPPoEoE w/VLAN only.
Outer VLAN user priority, PPPoEoE w/VLAN only.
Dependencies: only available when IxNetwork is used for the PPPoX configuration.

choice.choiceText: add a new PPPoX configuration
Remove an existing PPPoX configuration (specified by -handle)
modify an existing PPPoX configuration (specified by -handle)

description.text: Authentication mode.

choice.choiceText: (DEFAULT)
Accept both PAP and CHAP offered by DUT.

description.text: Specifies the time interval in seconds for sending LCP echo requests. Valid only if -echo_req is set to 1. When using IxNetwork this parameter can take values from the 1-3600 range.
<aa.bb.cc.dd.ee.ff>
<aa.bb.cc.dd.ee.ff> Dependencies: -mode add or modify (when IxNetwork is used for the PPPoX configuration).
Specifies the maximum number of LCP Configure Requests that can be sent without acknowledgement. When using IxNetwork this parameter can take values from the 1-255 range.
Specifies the maximum number of IPCP configure requests that can be sent without getting an ack from the DUT. When using IxNetwork this parameter can take values from the 1-255 range.
When the port is used as a server, this is the name sent in the PADO message.

This parameter configures Access Loop Characteristics. For details refer to -enable_server_signal_loop_char. The actual downstream data rate (sub-option 0x81), in kbps. Available only when IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Dependencies: -intermediate_agent 1

This parameter configures Access Loop Characteristics. For details refer to -enable_server_signal_loop_char. The actual upstream data rate (sub-option 0x82), in kbps Available only when IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Dependencies: -intermediate_agent 1

When intermediate_agent is true, the program inserts an Agent Circuit ID and an Agent Remote ID into PPPoE tags for each PPPoE session. These IDs serve to distinguish the CPE premises from each other. This field has a maximum length of 32 characters.The agent_circuit_id field is defined in strings of the form: %<start-width>:<count>:<repeat count>i.

When intermediate_agent is true, the program inserts an Agent Circuit ID and an Agent Remote ID into PPPoE tags for each PPPoE session. These IDs serve to distinguish the CPE premises from each other. This field has a maximum length of 32 characters. The agentRemoteId field is defined in strings of the form: %<start-width>:<count>:<repeat count>i.

When intermediate_agent is true, the program inserts an Agent Circuit ID and an Agent Remote ID and an Agent Access Aggregation Circuit ID into PPPoE tags for each PPPoE session. These IDs serve to distinguish the CPE premises from each other. This field has a maximum length of 32 characters.The agent_circuit_id field is defined in strings of the form: %<start-width>:<count>:<repeat count>i.

This parameter configures Signaling the Access Loop Encapsulation (sub-option 0x90), for details refer to -enable_server_signal_loop_encap. The PPPoE intermediate agent on the Access Node inserts the 0x90 sub-option to signal to the BNG the data-link protocol on the Access Loop. Available only when IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Dependencies: -intermediate_agent 1

This parameter configures the Interworking function (IWF). For details refer to -enable_server_signal_iwf. When enabled, the Access Node provides protocol translation between the ATM layer on the user side and the Ethernet layer on the network side. Available only when IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Dependencies: -intermediate_agent 1; -port_role access

List of domain group to LNS IP mapping. Each domain group can have thousands of domains. With the help of domain group it is very easy to map thousands of domains to one or more LNS IP addresses. Each domain group is defined as: { { domain_name } {lnsIP1 lnsIP2} }. Where domain_name is defined as: {name wc wc_start wc_end <wc_repeat >} name <string> : name to be used for the domain(s). wc {1|0} : enables wildcard substitution in the name field. wc_start <0-65535> : starting value for wildcard symbol for the name (%) substitution wc_end <0-65535> : ending value for wildcard symbol for the name (%) substitution lnsIP <a.b.c.d> : LNS IP address list to be used for this domain. Example: You want to set up 20 domains, out of which cisco1.com to cisco10.com going to 192.1.1.1 & 192.1.1.2 and cisco11.com to cisco20.com going to 192.1.2.1. Also assume number of sessions per tunnel is 5. Your domain group list will look like: { { {cisco%.com 1 1 10} {192.1.1.1 192.1.1.2} } { {cisco%.com 1 11 20} {192.1.2.1} } } Tunnel Allocation will look like this: Sessions 1-5, tunnel1 dst 192.1.1.1; Sessions 5-10, tunnel2 dst 192.1.1.2; Sessions 11-15, tunnel3 dst 192.1.2.1; Sessions 16-20, tunnel4 dst 192.1.2.1.

This parameter configures the Interworking function (IWF). For details refer to -enable_server_signal_iwf. When enabled, the Access Node provides protocol translation between the ATM layer on the user side and the Ethernet layer on the network side. Available only when IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Dependencies: -intermediate_agent 1; -port_role access

This parameter configures Access Loop Characteristics. For details refer to -enable_server_signal_loop_char. When this parameter is enabled, the discovery packets will include the 0x81 and 0x82 sub-options. Available only when IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Dependencies: -intermediate_agent 1; -port_role access

This parameter configures Signaling the Access Loop Encapsulation (sub-option 0x90), for details refer to -enable_server_signal_loop_encap When this parameter is enabled, the discovery packets will include the 0x90 sub-option. Available only when IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Dependencies: -intermediate_agent 1; -port_role access

When this parameter is 1, the discovery packets will include the -agent_circuit_id and -agent_remote_id options. Available only when IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Dependencies: -intermediate_agent 1; -port_role access

This parameter configures the Interworking function (IWF) - When ATM is supported on the DSL line (the U interface), the Access Node must provide protocol translation between the ATM layer on the user side and the Ethernet layer on the network side. When enabled, the Access Node provides protocol translation between the ATM layer on the user side and the Ethernet layer on the network side. Available only when IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Dependencies: -intermediate_agent 1; -port_role network

This parameter configures Access Loop Characteristics - the Access Node reports the access loop sync rate and interleave delay to the Broadband Network Gateway (BNG). This allows the BNG to enable policy decisions and advanced QoS enforcement, while potentially taking full advantage of the data rate of a given access loop. When this parameter is enabled, the discovery packets will include the 0x81 and 0x82 sub-options. Available only when IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Dependencies: -intermediate_agent 1; -port_role network

This parameter configures Signaling the Access Loop Encapsulation (sub-option 0x90): for access loop encapsulation the PPPoE intermediate agent inserts information in the PPPoE packets to signal to the BNG the data-link protocol and the encapsulation overhead on the Access Loop. For signaling of interworked sessions the Access Node must signal the BNG that a given PPPoE session is going to carry interworked PPPoA traffic. When this parameter is enabled, the discovery packets will include the 0x90 sub-option. Available only when IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Dependencies: -intermediate_agent 1; -port_role network

When this parameter is 1, the discovery packets will include the -agent_circuit_id and -agent_remote_id options. Available only when IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Dependencies: -intermediate_agent 1; -port_role network

Enables the Intermediate Agent feature. This feature allows for the testing of DSLAM/BRAS devices that translate from PPPoA traffic to PPPoE traffic. When this option is true, the program inserts agent_circuit_id and agent_remote_id values into PPPoE tags for each PPPoE session.

This parameter configures Signaling the Access Loop Encapsulation (sub-option 0x90), for details refer to -enable_server_signal_loop_encap. The PPPoE intermediate agent on the Access Node inserts the 0x90 sub-option to signal to the BNG the encapsulation overhead on the Access Loop. Available only when IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Dependencies: -intermediate_agent 1

This parameter configures Signaling the Access Loop Encapsulation (sub-option 0x90), for details refer to -enable_server_signal_loop_encap. The PPPoE intermediate agent on the Access Node inserts the 0x90 sub-option to signal to the BNG the encapsulation overhead on the Access Loop. Available only when IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Dependencies: -intermediate_agent 1

restriction.value: na pppoa_llc pppoa_null ipoa_llc ipoa_null eth_aal5_llc_fcs eth_aal5_llc_no_fcs eth_aal5_null_fcs eth_aal5_null_no_fcs

description.text: Select the protocol used to set IPv6 global interfaces on PPP interfaces. This configuration applies at port level. Dependencies: Available starting with HLT API 3.90. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.

choice.choiceText: (DEFAULT) IPv6 global address is fetched like before ' using ICMPV4 RA/RS messages.

PPP plugin will trigger - for each session, after completing the IPCPv6 phase ' the DHCPv6-PD port plugin to request a pool prefix and DNS server list. the IPv6 pool prefix will be used for both PPP-IPv6 interface global address and the DHCPv6 hosts behind the CPE.

description.text: Pool prefix length. The difference between the address and pool prefix lengths determine the size of the IPv6 IP pool
Pool prefix length. The difference between the address and pool prefix lengths determine the size of the IPv6 IP pool
The IPv6 address prefix length.
The local base IPv6 interface ID.
The first address assigned on the local PPP node.
The value by which ppp_local_ip is incremented for each session.
Server IPv6CP interface identifier increment, used in conjuction with the base identifier
The peer base IPv6 interface ID.
Client IPv6CP interface identifier increment, used in conjuction with the base identifier
The first address assigned on the peer PPP node.
The value by which ppp_peer_ip is incremented for each session.
If true, enables access ports to redial at the PPPoE level.
The maximum number of redial attempts. When using IxNetwork this parameter can take values from the 1-255 range.
The time to wait before restarting a session if the call was dropped, expressed in seconds. When using IxNetwork this parameter can take values from the 1-65535 range.

This string is used for matching of the PADO messages for the client. For server ports, this string is also sent by the server as the server name in the PADO message. Any string up to 32 characters in length may be used.The string may contain text characters, plus a specification of the form: %[<start-width>:<modulo>:<repeat>]i
The type of Access Concentrator matching that is desired.

choice.choiceText: (DEFAULT) A service name is not required; a null service is sent during Discovery indicating to the access concentrator that the service is not specified.
Allows a matching service name to be configured in the service_name option.

description.text: Enable RDNSS routing advertisments
DNS server list separacted by semicolon. Enabled just for IPv6 and send_dns_options.
Valid only when client_netmask_options is request_specific_netmask
Valid only when client_wins_options is request_primaryonly_wins or accept_only_primary_address_from_server
Valid only when client_wins_options is request_primaryonly_wins
Valid only when server_netmask_options is supply_netmask
Valid when server_wins_options is supply_primary_and_secondary or supply_primary_only.
Valid when server_wins_options is supply_primary_and_secondary.
Time to wait (in seconds) for Router Advertisment before NCP up. Valid only for port_role access.
Enable echo request/reply. This command applies only for PPPv4 clients. Valid only for port_role access.
Specifies the rate in attempts/second at which attempts are made to bring up sessions. When using IxNetwork this parameter can take values from the 1-1000 range.
The number of triggered instances of an action that is still awaiting a response or completion
Time interval used to calculate the rate for triggering an action(rate = count/interval)

Indicates whether the control is specified per port or per device group. This setting is global for all the pppoxclient protocols configured in the ixncfg and can be configured just when handle is /globals (when the user wants to configure just the global settings)
Specifies the rate in disconnects/s at which sessions are disconnected. This parameter can take values from the 1-1000 range.

Indicates whether the control is specified per port or per device group. This setting is global for all the pppoxclient protocols configured in the ixncfg and can be configured just when handle is /globals (when the user wants to configure just the global settings)
The number of triggered instances of an action that is still awaiting a response or completion
Time interval used to calculate the rate for triggering an action(rate = count/interval)

Indicates whether the control is specified per port or per device group. This setting is global for all the pppoxclient protocols configured in the ixncfg and can be configured just when handle is /globals (when the user wants to configure just the global settings)
Enable session lifetime
Minimum session lifetime (in seconds)
Maximum session lifetime (in seconds)
Enable automatic session restart after stop at lifetime expiry
Maximum number of times each session is automatically restarted
Allow each session to always be automatically restarted
Configures a PAP/CHAP authenticator to accept all offered usernames, passwords, and base domain names
The port on which the PPPoX sessions is to be created. Dependencies: -mode add (when IxNetwork is used for the PPPoX configuration).
Type of sessions to be configured. Valid options are: pppoa pppoeoa pppoe Only the pppoe options is supported.
Encapsulation type for session. Dependencies: -mode add (when IxNetwork is used for the PPPoX configuration) and -protocol.

choice.choiceText: Ethernet (valid for -protocol pppoe)
Ethernet with VLAN (valid for -protocol pppoe)
Ethernet with stacked VLAN (valid for -protocol pppoe)
VC Mux Bridged Ethernet (FCS) (valid for -protocol pppoeoa)
VC Mux IPv4/IPv6 Routed (valid for -protocol pppoa)
VC Mux Bridged Ethernet (no FCS) (valid for -protocol pppoeoa)
LLC Bridged Ethernet (FCS) (valid for -protocol pppoeoa)
LLC Routed AAL5 Snap (valid for -protocol pppoa)
LLC Bridged Ethernet (no FCS) (valid for -protocol pppoeoa)

restriction.value: ethernet_ii ethernet_ii_vlan ethernet_ii_qinq vc_mux vc_mux_routed vc_mux_nofcs llcsnap llcsnap_routed llcsnap_nofcs

description.text: How often a new outer VLAN ID is generated. For example, a value of 10 will cause a new VLAN ID to be used in blocks of 10 IP addresses.
How often a new inner VLAN ID is generated. For example, a value of 10 will cause a new VLAN ID to be used in blocks of 10 IP addresses.

choice.choiceText: Increment the inner VLAN ID. Based on the vlan_id parameter first then increment the outer vlan_id_outer parameters next.
Increment the outer first then inner.
(DEFAULT) Increment both inner and outer at the same time.

description.text: Starting outer VLAN ID, applies to PPPoE w/Stacked VLAN only.
Number of outer VLAN IDs, applies to PPPoE w/Stacked VLAN only.
Step value applied to outer VLAN ID, PPPoEoE w/Stacked VLAN only.

Enables wildcard substituation in the password field. Notes: If mode is modify, all the wildcard parameters (password username_wildcard password_wildcard wildcard_pound_start wildcard_pound_end wildcard_question_start wildcard_question_end) must be reconfigured. Otherwise invalid configurations may result.

Enables wildcard substitution in the username field. Notes: If mode is modify, all the wildcard parameters (username username_wildcard password_wildcard wildcard_pound_start wildcard_pound_end wildcard_question_start wildcard_question_end) must be reconfigured. Otherwise invalid configurations may result.

Starting value for wildcard symbol 1 (\) substitution. It is also valid to use as the substitution symbol. Enables wildcard substitution in the username field. Notes: If mode is modify, all the wildcard parameters (username username_wildcard password_wildcard wildcard_pound_start wildcard_pound_end wildcard_question_start wildcard_question_end) must be reconfigured. Otherwise invalid configurations may result. This parameter can be provided in various formats. For example, the number 2 can be provided as follows: 2, 02, 002, 0002, 00002.

Ending value for wildcard symbol 1 (\) substitution. It is also valid to use as the substitution symbol. Enables wildcard substitution in the username field. Notes: If mode is modify, all the wildcard parameters (username username_wildcard password_wildcard wildcard_pound_start wildcard_pound_end wildcard_question_start wildcard_question_end) must be reconfigured. Otherwise invalid configurations may result. This parameter can be provided in various formats. For example, the number 2 can be provided as follows: 2, 02, 002, 0002, 00002. It must be the same format as for wildcard_pound_start.

Starting value for wildcard symbol 2 (?) substitution. Enables wildcard substitution in the username field. Notes: If mode is modify, all the wildcard parameters (username username_wildcard password_wildcard wildcard_pound_start wildcard_pound_end wildcard_question_start wildcard_question_end) must be reconfigured. Otherwise invalid configurations may result. This parameter can be provided in various formats. For example, the number 2 can be provided as follows: 2, 02, 002, 0002, 00002.

Ending value for wildcard symbol 2 (?) substitution. Enables wildcard substitution in the username field. Notes: If mode is modify, all the wildcard parameters (username username_wildcard password_wildcard wildcard_pound_start wildcard_pound_end wildcard_question_start wildcard_question_end) must be reconfigured. Otherwise invalid configurations may result. This parameter can be provided in various formats. For example, the number 2 can be provided as follows: 2, 02, 002, 0002, 00002. It must be the same format as for wildcard_question_start.

This option is used in case ac_select_mode is chosen as ac_mac or. ac_name. It specifies the AC MAC address and percentage pair as list: {00:11:00:00:00:11|50 00:11:00:00:00:12|50} or [list 00:11:00:00:00:11|50 00:11:00:00:00:12|50] or it specifies the ac name and percentage pair as list: {ciscoAC1|60 ciscoAC2|40} or [list ciscoAC1|60 ciscoAC2|40]
Number of Configure-Nak packets received before abandon link setup
Delay time in milliseconds to wait before sending LCP Config packet

Specifies the maximum number of sessions in progress, which includes the sessions in the process of either coming up or disconnecting, at one time. When using IxNetwork this parameter can take values from the 1-1000 range.

Valid choices are: 0 ' Configure standard PPPoE 1 ' Enable using DHCPv6 hosts behind PPP CPE feature. Dependencies: Available starting with HLT API 3.90. Valid when port_role is 'access' and 'mode is 'create'. Configurations created with 'dhcpv6_hosts_enable '0' cannot coexist on the same port with ranges created with 'dhcpv6_hosts_enable 1.

If 1 the DHCPv6 client will request the exact address as advertised by the server. This parameter applies globally for all the ports in the configuration. Available starting with HLT API 3.90 IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'. Valid choices are: 0 - (DEFAULT) Disabled 1 - Enabled

The maximum number of requests to be sent by all DHCP clients during session teardown. This parameter applies globally for all the ports in the configuration. Available starting with HLT API 3.90 IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.

The maximum number of requests to be sent by all DHCP clients during session startup. This parameter applies globally for all the ports in the configuration. Available starting with HLT API 3.90 IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.

RFC 3315 max rebind timeout value in seconds. This parameter applies globally for all the ports in the configuration. Available starting with HLT API 3.90 IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.

RFC 3315 initial rebind timeout value in seconds. This parameter applies globally for all the ports in the configuration. Available starting with HLT API 3.90 IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.

RFC 3315 release attempts. This parameter applies globally for all the ports in the configuration. Available starting with HLT API 3.90 IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.

RFC 3315 initial release timeout in seconds. This parameter applies globally for all the ports in the configuration. Available starting with HLT API 3.90 IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.

RFC 3315 max renew timeout in secons. This parameter applies globally for all the ports in the configuration. Available starting with HLT API 3.90 IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.

RFC 3315 initial renew timeout in secons. This parameter applies globally for all the ports in the configuration. Available starting with HLT API 3.90 IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.

RFC 3315 max request retry attempts. This parameter applies globally for all the ports in the configuration. Available starting with HLT API 3.90 IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.

RFC 3315 max request timeout value in secons. This parameter applies globally for all the ports in the configuration. Available starting with HLT API 3.90 IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.

RFC 3315 initial request timeout value in secons. This parameter applies globally for all the ports in the configuration. Available starting with HLT API 3.90 IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.

Setup rate is the number of clients to start in each second. This value represents the initial value for setup rate. This parameter applies globally for all the ports in the configuration. Available starting with HLT API 3.90 IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.

RFC 3315 max solicit retry attempts. This parameter applies globally for all the ports in the configuration. Available starting with HLT API 3.90 IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.

RFC 3315 max solicit timeout value in seconds. This parameter applies globally for all the ports in the configuration. Available starting with HLT API 3.90 IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.

RFC 3315 initial solicit timeout value in seconds. This parameter applies globally for all the ports in the configuration. Available starting with HLT API 3.90 IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.

Setup rate is the number of clients to stop in each second. This value represents the initial value for teardown rate. This parameter applies globally for all the ports in the configuration. Available starting with HLT API 3.90 IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.

choice.choiceText: DHCPv6PDoPPPServer
DHCPv6PDoPPPClient
duid_en
(DEFAULT) duid_llt
duid_ll

description.text: Define the vendor-assigned unique ID for this range. This ID is incremented automatically for each DHCP client. Dependencies: Available starting with HLT API 3.90. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'; dhcp6_pd_client_range_duid_type is 'duid_en'.

Define the step to increment the vendor ID for each DHCP client. Dependencies: Available starting with HLT API 3.90. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'; dhcp6_pd_client_range_duid_type is 'duid_en'.

Define the identity association unique ID for this range. This ID is incremented automatically for each DHCP client. Dependencies: Available starting with HLT API 3.90. Valid when port_role is ' access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.

Define the step used to increment dhcp6_pd_client_range_ia_id for each DHCP client. Dependencies: Available starting with HLT API 3.90. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.

Define the suggested time at which the client contacts the server from which the addresses were obtained to extend the lifetimes of the addresses assigned. Dependencies: Available starting with HLT API 3.90. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.

Define the suggested time at which the client contacts any available server to extend the lifetimes of the addresses assigned. Dependencies: Available starting with HLT API 3.90. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.

Define Identity Association Type. Valid choices are: IAPD, IANA, IATA, IANA_IAPD Dependencies: Available starting with HLT API 3.90. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.

Define the user-defined lease renewal timer. The value is estimated in seconds and will override the lease renewal timer if it is not zero and is smaller than the server-defined value. Dependencies: Available starting with HLT API 3.90. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.
Specifies the domain that the client will use when resolving host names with DNS.
The first DNS server associated with this address pool. This is the first DNS address that will be assigned to any client that is allocated an IP address from this pool.
The second DNS server associated with this address pool. This is the second (of two) DNS addresses that will be assigned to any client that is allocated an IP address from this pool.
The prefix value used to subnet the addresses specified in the address pool. This is the subnet prefix length advertised in DHCPv6PD Offer and Reply messages.
The starting IPv6 address for this DHCPv6 address pool.

The maximum number of requests to be sent by all DHCP clients during session startup. This parameter applies globally for all the ports in the configuration. Available starting with HLT API 3.90 IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'. Parameter dhcp6_pgdata_override_global_setup_rate is '1'

This parameter refers to the DHCPv6 Client Port Group Data. This parameter applies at the port level. Dependencies: Available starting with HLT API 3.90. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'.

This parameter refers to the DHCPv6 Client Port Group Data. This parameter applies at the port level. Dependencies: Available starting with HLT API 3.90. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'. Parameter dhcp6_pgdata_override_global_setup_rate is '1'

The maximum number of requests to be sent by all DHCP clients during session teardown. This parameter applies globally for all the ports in the configuration. Available starting with HLT API 3.90 IxNetwork is used for PPPoX configurations. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'. Parameter dhcp6_pgdata_override_global_teardown_rate is '1'

This parameter refers to the DHCPv6 Client Port Group Data. This parameter applies at the port level. Dependencies: Available starting with HLT API 3.90. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'

Description This parameter refers to the DHCPv6 Client Port Group Data. This parameter applies at the port level. Dependencies: Available starting with HLT API 3.90. Valid when port_role is 'access'; dhcpv6_hosts_enable is 1; ip_cp is 'ipv6_cp' or 'dual_stack'. Parameter dhcp6_pgdata_override_global_teardown_rate is '1'

The duration of an address lease, in seconds, if the client requesting the lease does not ask for a specific expiration time. The default value is 3600; the minimum is 300; and the maximum is 30,000,000.
Enables PPPoE Host-Uniq tag
Rx Connect Speed for the client
Tx Connect Speed for the client
If checked, LAC will send Connect Speed Update Enable AVP in ICRQ control message
Host-Uniq
Host-Uniq
number of layer instances per parent instance (multiplier)
DSL Type to be advertised in PPPoE VSA Tag. For undefined DSL type user has to select "User-defined DSL Type".

choice.choiceText: (DEFAULT)
User defined value for DSL type TLV.

restriction.value: none adsl_1 adsl_2 adsl_2_p vdsl_1 vdsl_2 sdsl g_fast svvdsl sdsl_bonded vdsl_bonded g_fast_bonded svvdsl_bonded other userdefined

description.text: User Defined DSL-Type Value.
DSL-Type TLV to be inserted in PPPoE VSA Tag.
PON Type to be advertised in PPPoE VSA Tag. For undefined PON type user has to select "User-defined PON Type".

choice.choiceText: (DEFAULT)
User defined value for DSL type TLV.

restriction.value: none gpon xg_pon_1 twdm_pon xgs_pon wdm_pon other userdefined

description.text: User Defined PON-Type Value.
PON-Type TLV to be inserted in PPPoE VSA Tag.
The presence of the LCP MRRU option indicates that the PPP multilink protocol is implemented by the system sending it.

The maximum number of octets in the information fields of reassembled packets of the MRRU. Select to configure the MRRU size used in negotiation of the multilink protocol MRRU option in the LCP stage. Valid values are: 576 to 9000. Default value is 1492.
Select to define the ML-PPP endpoint discriminator options in the LCP-Configure request.

choice.choiceText: It has a Null value. Null Class (Default).
The IP address used in the ML-PPP endpoint discriminator option of the LCP configure request sent by PPP clients.
The MAC addresses are automatically derived from the local MAC address. An address in this class contains an IEEE 802.1 MAC address is canonical (802.3) format.

description.text: The IP address used in the ML-PPP endpoint discriminator option of the LCP configure request sent by PPP clients.
The MAC addresses are automatically derived from the local MAC address. An address in this class contains an IEEE 802.1 MAC address is canonical (802.3) format.

returnValue.value: A list containing the pppox client protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the pppox server protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the pppox server sessions protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the dhcpv6 client protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).
A list containing the dhcpv6 server protocol stack handles that were added by the command (if any).

A list containing individual interface, session and/or router handles that were added by the command (if any). Please note that this key will be omitted if the current session or command were run with -return_detailed_handles 0.
When status is failure, contains more information

notes.note: 1) Coded versus functional specification. 2) When -handle is provided with the /globals value the arguments that configure global protocol setting accept both multivalue handles and simple values. When -handle is provided with a a protocol stack handle or a protocol session handle, the arguments that configure global settings will only accept simple values. In this situation, these arguments will configure only the settings of the parent device group or the ports associated with the parent topology. If the current session or command was run with -return_detailed_handles 0 the following keys will be omitted from the command response: handle
